timeline.message: The bounds of intersection types are not just declared types.

Merge remote-tracking branch 'remotes/origin/master' into intersections

# Conflicts:
#	framework/src/main/java/org/checkerframework/framework/flow/CFTreeBuilder.java

timeline.bodyText:
In this example, the annotation isn't just copied to the primary annotation location, but to every bound of the intersection.
Also, it would be helpful to indicate that the primary annotation location is different than all the annotations on the bounds.  The example doesn't actually show the primary annotation location.  So, I find the example a bit confusing.
timeline.author: mernst

timeline.bodyText: When this is called, have the primary annotations already been applied to every bound, so that each bound stands on its own without any need to refer to the primary annotations?
timeline.author: mernst

replies.bodyText: Yes.  This method is only called on fully-annotated types.  That means that the intersection type has a primary annotation for every qualifier hierarchy.
replies.author: smillst
